intro: Stellaria cherleriae var. fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pink star-shaped flowers and hairy, lanceolate leaves. Native to mountainous regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
